definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Lunch and Dhamma talk will be conducted from 11:00am onwards.
sentences.chinese: 午斋与开示将从十一点开始。

sentences.english: Evidence open showing is an important centre that is of the antagonism type .
sentences.chinese: 证据开示是支撑对抗式审判制度的重要基点。

sentences.english: There are some factors restricting the foundation of the discovery system of administrative procedure.
sentences.chinese: 证据开示是现代对抗式诉讼模式的一项重要制度。

sentences.english: The topic for this second set of teachings the Gyalwang Karmapa has given at the foundation was 'Cultivating Compassion.
sentences.chinese: 噶玛巴在法会上的第二个开示是“修持慈悲心”。

sentences.english: This talk was given the next day and continues with the fore-going.
sentences.chinese: 这段是隔天才开示的，并且继续前面的话题。

sentences.english: The Zhouyi communicates with the heaven above for two subjects : sage and king.
sentences.chinese: 开示通天者有二，一为圣人，一为王。

sentences.english: One of the ways of changing the situation is the practice of the testimony showing in criminal suits.
sentences.chinese: 改变这种现状的办法之一就是实行刑事证据开示制度。

sentences.english: When there's a Dhamma talk, you don't have to listen.
sentences.chinese: 有开示时，你不一定要聆听。

sentences.english: Such was the Venerable Acharn's instruction regarding love.
sentences.chinese: 这就是尊者阿迦曼有关爱情的开示。

sentences.english: Listen to a cassette tape of a teaching by a great master, or a sacredchant.
sentences.chinese: 你可以听大师开示的录音带，或神圣的唱诵。

to pray to Buddha/to chant the names of Buddha
(of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
Avatamsaka sutra of the Huayan school/also called Buddhavatamsaka-mahavaipulya Sutra, the Flower adornment sutra or the Garland sutra
to pass on doctrines from master to disciple (Buddhism)
Buddhist teacher (Sanskrit transliteration)/also written 阿闍梨|阿阇梨[a1 she2 li2]
to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
Buddhist teacher (Sanskrit transliteration)/also written 阿闍黎|阿阇黎[a1 she2 li2]
another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha
Buddha (a person who has attained Buddhahood, or specifically Siddhartha Gautama)
